title:
A Non-Archimedean Second Main Theorem for Hypersurfaces in Subgeneral
  Position
authors: Ta Thi Hoai An, William Cherry, and Nguyen Viet Phuong
abstract:
We apply an idea of Levin to obtain a non-truncated second main theorem for
non-Archimedean analytic maps approximating algebraic hypersurfaces in
subgeneral position. In some cases, for example when all the hypersurfaces are
non-linear and all the intersections are transverse, this improves an
inequality of Quang, whose inequality is sharp for the case of hyperplanes in
subgeneral position.
